Package it.polimi.ingsw.Server.Model

Class BasicRulesTest

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.Server.Model.BasicRulesTest
public class BasicRulesTest
extends java.lang.Object
this class is used to test the behaviour of MovementPhase

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private Board board
    the board used by the game
    private Game game
    the three-player game used for the test
    private NetInterface netInterface
    the netInterface used in the game
    private Player player1
    the player used for the test
    private BasicRules rules
    the basic rules used in the game

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    BasicRulesTest()  

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void checkGetBuildingRange()
    checks the correct behaviour of the method getBuildingRange(). 1) In the worker's surroundings there are two workers, a complete tower, a three-floor tower and a dome.
    void checkGetFreeSquares()
    checks the correct behaviour of the method getFreeSquares(). 1) Inside the board there are three workers, a complete tower and a dome
    void checkProximity()
    checks the correct behaviour of the method proximity. 1) Empty board.
    void checkRemoveBuilderSquare()
    checks the correct behaviour of the method removeBuilderSquare(). 1) In the worker's surroundings there are a dome, a three-floor building, an opponent worker and a worker belonging to the examined player
    void checkRemoveDomeSquare()
    checks the correct behaviour of the method removeDomeSquare(). 1) In the worker's surroundings there are a dome, a three-floor building, an opponent worker, a worker belonging to the examined player and a complete tower.
    void checkRemoveTooHighPlaces()
    checks the correct behaviour of the method removeTooHighPlaces(). 1) The worker is on a one-floor building and there are a three-floor building, a two_floor building in its surroundings 2) The worker is on the ground and there are a worker a three-floor tower and a two-floor tower in its surroundings 3) The worker is on a three-floor building and a three-floor building and a one-floor building in its surroundings
    void createGameAndRules()
    creates the players and the games used in every test
    void testNotWinningConditions()
    checks for unexpected behaviours in winCondition() that could result in the player's wrong victory 1) The worker hasn't moved from initialPosition 2) There's a worker in finalPosition, but the examined worker has stayed in initialPosition 3) finalPosition has not the right level in order to win 4) initialPosition has not the right level in order to win 5) the worker in finalPosition does not belong to the examined player
    void testWinCondition()
    checks the basic winning condition according to the general rules of the game: a worker moving from a two-floor building to a three-floor building

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • createGameAndRules

      creates the players and the games used in every test

    • testWinCondition

      public void testWinCondition() throws java.io.IOException
      checks the basic winning condition according to the general rules of the game: a worker moving from a two-floor building to a three-floor building
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • testNotWinningConditions

      public void testNotWinningConditions() throws java.io.IOException
      checks for unexpected behaviours in winCondition() that could result in the player's wrong victory 1) The worker hasn't moved from initialPosition 2) There's a worker in finalPosition, but the examined worker has stayed in initialPosition 3) finalPosition has not the right level in order to win 4) initialPosition has not the right level in order to win 5) the worker in finalPosition does not belong to the examined player
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • checkProximity

      public void checkProximity() throws java.io.IOException
      checks the correct behaviour of the method proximity. 1) Empty board. Checks that all the squares in possibleMoves are actually neighboring the examined worker. 2) Adding a dome, a worker and a three-level building in the proximity of the worker 3) The examined worker is placed at a corner of the board 4) The examined worker is placed on the border side of the board
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • checkRemoveBuilderSquare

      public void checkRemoveBuilderSquare() throws java.io.IOException
      checks the correct behaviour of the method removeBuilderSquare(). 1) In the worker's surroundings there are a dome, a three-floor building, an opponent worker and a worker belonging to the examined player
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • checkRemoveDomeSquare

      public void checkRemoveDomeSquare() throws java.io.IOException
      checks the correct behaviour of the method removeDomeSquare(). 1) In the worker's surroundings there are a dome, a three-floor building, an opponent worker, a worker belonging to the examined player and a complete tower.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • checkRemoveTooHighPlaces

      public void checkRemoveTooHighPlaces() throws java.io.IOException
      checks the correct behaviour of the method removeTooHighPlaces(). 1) The worker is on a one-floor building and there are a three-floor building, a two_floor building in its surroundings 2) The worker is on the ground and there are a worker a three-floor tower and a two-floor tower in its surroundings 3) The worker is on a three-floor building and a three-floor building and a one-floor building in its surroundings
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException
